definition: Change in response to treatment or cure of a disorder or disease.
A reduction in the desirable and beneficial effects resulting from a medical treatment.
An increase in the desirable and beneficial effects resulting from a medical treatment.
Unanticipated desirable and beneficial effects resulting from a medical treatment.
The cessation of life.

Death in utero; failure of the product of conception to show evidence of respiration, heart beat, or definite movement of a voluntary muscle after expulsion from the uterus, with no possibility of resuscitation.
The cessation of life due to permanent loss of brain function and brainstem for absence of responsiveness to external stimuli, absence of reflex and apnea.
Patient diagnosis was clinically significant delayed as a consequence of device performance.
Patient treatment was delayed as a consequence of device performance.

Situation in which the use of the device impedes or affects a subsequent medical procedure or use of a medicine or device. The time elapsed between the use of the device and the medical procedure is not a factor. It is not necessary for the device to have broken or malfunctioned.
Use of the device has lead to worsening of the existing disease or condition.
Hospitalization or prolonged hospitalization due to the health damage accompanying the use of device.
Patient requires admission to or extension of stay in an intensive care unit.
Fetal distress, congenital physical or mental impairment or birth defect, excluding fetal death.

Patient did not receive intended treatment from a device or received inadequate treatment as a consequence of device performance. This includes inadequate/inappropriate radiation dosage during procedures.
Patient treatment was absent as a consequence of device performance.
Receiving incorrect or incompatible whole blood or a blood component.
A dose of medicine was not taken or delivered at the prescribed dosing interval.
Exposure to, or intake of, an insufficient amount of a substance.
A lower than intended dose of radiation to a single field.
Exposure to, or intake of, an excessive amount of a substance.
A higher than intended cumulative dose of radiation to a single field.
A mild injury, illness or impairment which can be treated with minimal or no intervention.
A severe injury, illness or impairment which requires hospitalization or medical intervention.
Disease that persists over a long period of time, cannot be prevented by vaccines or cured by medication, nor do they just disappear.
Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.
Patient suffered an illness or injury which if not treated would be fatal.
Irreversible deterioration of the state of health.
Reversible deterioration of the state of health.
An incorrect diagnosis or classification of an illness or other problem.
Clinically significant extended treatment time or procedural time. Not to be used for prolonged hospitalization or prolonged surgery.
Status Description: Editorial change to the definition on 16 February 2021.

definition: Patient experiencing a complication that is well documented in association with the device or procedure.
Decrease in lifetime/ lifespan of an individual. Decline in the normal duration or in average life.
Patient required sedation or additional sedation.
Patient requires treatment to facilitate the process of recovery from injury, illness, or disease.
One or more surgical procedures was required, or an existing procedure changed.
Surgical intervention that was not planned and needed to be performed in addition to other interventions including surgical ones.
Patient required surgical removal of limb, extremities or other external body parts.
Patient required a corrective invasive procedure to remove a device, or parts/fragments of a device.

Patient required a corrective invasive procedure in which a device was repositioned. This includes implantable, surgically invasive (penetration through the surface of the body) or invasive (penetration though a natural body orifice or permanent artificial opening, e.g. stoma) devices.

Patient required a corrective invasive procedure in which a device was replaced/revised. This includes implantable, surgically invasive (penetration through the surface of the body) or invasive (penetration though a natural body orifice or permanent artificial opening, e.g. stoma) devices.
A change of surgical procedures from the original plan.
Surgery that is more complicated, more comprehensive or more extensive than planned.
Surgery that takes longer than anticipated.
Surgical procedure unable to be completed when originally scheduled and put off until some time in the future.
Any event type, which results in imminent risk of death, serious injury, or serious illness to more than one individual, that requires prompt remedial action.
Unexpected clinical deterioration of patient.
Diagnostic intervention needed to be completed that was not originally planned.
Patient required removal of tissue or fluid specimen to establish a diagnosis.
Patient required additional or unexpected endoscopic procedure.
Requirement for imaging that was not originally planned.
Patient required additional or unexpected IVD testing.
Status Description: Editorial change to the definition on 16 February 2021.

definition: Patient required an unforeseen medical intervention, excluding surgery, which was not on the original treatment plan.
Use of an additional or alternative device require to achieve optimal outcome.
Patient required an infusion of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.
Patient required additional medication or additional dose of existing medication.
A medication or course of action used to prevent a possible disease or condition from occurring.
Patient required additional radiation therapy.
Status Description: Editorial change to the definition on 16 February 2021.

definition: Patient required resuscitation.
There is not yet enough information available to classify the health impact.
Complication occurring in the patient that had not previously been identified or expected for this device.
Status Description: Editorial change to the definition on 16 February 2021.

definition: No apparent harm occurred in relation to the adverse event.
Status Description: Editorial change to the definition on 16 February 2021.

definition: No patient involvement when the adverse event occurred (for example happened during set-up or cleaning).

The Health Impact is not adequately described by any other term. Note: this code must not be used unless there is no other feasible code. The preferred term should be documented when submitting an adverse event report. This information will be used to determine if a new term should be added to the code table.
